register.description: The GPMC_REVISION register contains the IP revision code.

bitfield.description: IP revision. Major revision is [7:4]. Minor revision is [3:0]. Examples: 10h for revision 1.0, 21h for revision 2.1.

register.description: The GPMC_SYSCONFIG register controls the various parameters of the OCP interface.

bitfield.description: Idle mode
Software reset (Set 1 to this bit triggers a module reset. This bit is automatically reset by hardware. During reads, it always returns 0).
Internal OCP clock gating strategy.

register.description: The GPMC_SYSSTATUS register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Internal reset monitoring

register.description: The GPMC_IRQSTATUS interrupt status register regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt.

bitfield.description: Status of the Wait1 Edge Detection interrupt
Status of the Wait0 Edge Detection interrupt
Status of the TerminalCountEvent interrupt
Status of the FIFOEvent interrupt

register.description: The GPMC_IRQENABLE interrupt enable register allows to mask/unmask the module internal sources of interrupt, on a event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Enables the Wait1 Edge Detection interrupt
Enables the Wait0 Edge Detection interrupt
Enables TerminalCountEvent interrupt issuing in pre-fetch or write posting mode
Enables the FIFOEvent interrupt

register.description: The GPMC_TIMEOUT_CONTROL register allows the user to set the start value of the timeout counter

bitfield.description: Start value of the time-out counter (000 corresponds to 0 GPMC.FCLK cycle, 1h corresponds to 1 GPMC.FCLK cycle, and 1FFh corresponds to 511 GPMC.FCLK cycles)
Enable bit of the TimeOut feature

register.description: The GPMC_ERR_ADDRESS register stores the address of the illegal access when an error occurs.

bitfield.description: Address of illegal access: A30 (0 for memory region, 1 for GPMC register region) and A29 to A0 (1GByte maximum)

register.description: The GPMC_ERR_TYPE register stores the type of error when an error occurs.

bitfield.description: System Command of the transaction that caused the error
Not supported Address error
Not supported Command error
Time-out error
Error validity status - Must be explicitly cleared with a write 1 transaction

register.description: The configuration register allows global configuration of the GPMC.

bitfield.description: Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT1.
Selects the polarity of input pin WAIT0.
Controls the WP output pin level.
Limited Address device support.

register.description: The status register provides global status bits of the GPMC.

bitfield.description: Is a copy of input pin WAIT1. (Reset value is WAIT1 input pin sampled at IC reset)
Is a copy of input pin WAIT0. (Reset value is WAIT0 input pin sampled at IC reset)
Stores the empty status of the write buffer

register.description: The configuration 1 register sets signal control parameters per chip select.

bitfield.description: Enables the wrapping burst capability. Must be set if the attached device is configured in wrapping burst
Selects the read single or multiple access
Selects the read mode operation
Selects the write single or multiple access
Selects the write mode operation
Output GPMC.CLK activation time
Specifies the attached device page (burst) length (1 Word = Interface size)
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Read accesses.
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Write accesses
Selects input pin Wait monitoring time
Selects the input WAIT pin for this chip select.
Selects the device size attached (Reset value is SYSBOOT[8] input pin sampled at IC reset for CS[0] (active low) and 01 for CS[1] to CS[6] (active low)).
Selects the attached device type
Enables the Address and data multiplexed protocol (Reset value is SYSBOOT[11] and SYSBOOT[10] input pins sampled at IC reset for CS[0] (active low) and 0 for CS[1] to CS[6] (active low)).

Signals timing latencies scalar factor (Rd/WRCycleTime, AccessTime, PageBurstAccessTime, CSOnTime, CSRd/WrOffTime, ADVOnTime, ADVRd/WrOffTime, OEOnTime, OEOffTime, WEOnTime, WEOffTime, Cycle2CycleDelay, BusTurnAround, TimeOutStartValue)
Divides the GPMC.FCLK clock

register.description: Chip-select signal timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
CS# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
CS# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: ADV# signal timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: ADV# de-assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
ADV# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Multiplexed protocol
ADV# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: WE# and OE# signals timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: WE# de-assertion time from start cycle time
WE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
WE# assertion time from start cycle time
OE# de-assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Multiplexed access
OE# de-assertion time from start cycle time
OE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
OE# assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Multiplexed access
OE# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: RdAccessTime and CycleTime timing parameters configuration.

bitfield.description: Delay between successive words in a multiple access
Delay between start cycle time and first data valid
Total write cycle time
Total read cycle time

register.description: WrAccessTime, WrDataOnADmuxBus, Cycle2Cycle, and BusTurnAround parameters configuration

bitfield.description: Delay from StartAccessTime to the GPMC.FCLK rising edge corresponding the the GPMC.CLK rising edge used by the attached memory for the first data capture
Specifies on which GPMC.FCLK rising edge the first data of the synchronous burst write is driven in the add/data multiplexed bus
Chip select high pulse delay between two successive accesses
Add Cycle2CycleDelay between two successive accesses to the same chip-select (any access type)
Add Cycle2CycleDelay between two successive accesses to a different chip-select (any access type)
Bus turn around latency between two successive accesses to the same chip-select (read to write) or to a different chip-select (read to read and read to write)

register.description: Chip-select address mapping configuration.

bitfield.description: Chip-select mask address. Values not listed must be avoided as they create holes in the chip-select address space.
Chip-select enable (reset value is 1 for CS[0] (active low) and 0 for CS[1] to CS[5] (active low)).
Chip-select base address. CSi base address where i = 0 to 3 (16 Mbytes minimum granularity). Bits 5 to 0 correspond to A29, A28, A27, A26, A25, and A24.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_COMMAND_0 location places the data as the NAND command value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_ADDRESS_0 location places the data as the NAND partial address value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Reading data from the GPMC_NAND_DATA_0 location or from any location in the associated chip-select memory region activates an asynchronous read access.

register.description: The configuration 1 register sets signal control parameters per chip select.

bitfield.description: Enables the wrapping burst capability. Must be set if the attached device is configured in wrapping burst
Selects the read single or multiple access
Selects the read mode operation
Selects the write single or multiple access
Selects the write mode operation
Output GPMC.CLK activation time
Specifies the attached device page (burst) length (1 Word = Interface size)
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Read accesses.
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Write accesses
Selects input pin Wait monitoring time
Selects the input WAIT pin for this chip select.
Selects the device size attached (Reset value is SYSBOOT[8] input pin sampled at IC reset for CS[0] (active low) and 01 for CS[1] to CS[6] (active low)).
Selects the attached device type.
Enables the Address and data multiplexed protocol (Reset value is SYSBOOT[11] and SYSBOOT[10] input pins sampled at IC reset for CS[0] (active low) and 0 for CS[1] to CS[6] (active low)).

Signals timing latencies scalar factor (Rd/WRCycleTime, AccessTime, PageBurstAccessTime, CSOnTime, CSRd/WrOffTime, ADVOnTime, ADVRd/WrOffTime, OEOnTime, OEOffTime, WEOnTime, WEOffTime, Cycle2CycleDelay, BusTurnAround, TimeOutStartValue)
Divides the GPMC.FCLK clock.

register.description: Chip-select signal timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
CS# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
CS# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: ADV# signal timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: ADV# de-assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
ADV# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Multiplexed protocol
ADV# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: WE# and OE# signals timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: WE# de-assertion time from start cycle time
WE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
WE# assertion time from start cycle time
OE# de-assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Multiplexed access
OE# de-assertion time from start cycle time
OE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
OE# assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Multiplexed access
OE# assertion time from start cycle time

bitfield.description: Delay between successive words in a multiple access
Delay between start cycle time and first data valid
Total write cycle time
Total read cycle time

Chip-select base address. CSi base address where i = 0 to 3 (16 Mbytes minimum granularity). Bits 5 to 0 correspond to A29, A28, A27, A26, A25, and A24.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_COMMAND_1 location places the data as the NAND command value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: Chip-select address mapping configuration.

bitfield.description: Chip-select mask address. Values not listed must be avoided as they create holes in the chip-select address space.
Chip-select enable (reset value is 1 for CS[0] (active low) and 0 for CS[1] to CS[5] (active low)).
Chip-select base address. CSi base address where i = 0 to 3 (16 Mbytes minimum granularity). Bits 5 to 0 correspond to A29, A28, A27, A26, A25, and A24.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_COMMAND_5 location places the data as the NAND command value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_ADDRESS_5 location places the data as the NAND partial address value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Reading data from the GPMC_NAND_DATA_5 location or from any location in the associated chip-select memory region activates an asynchronous read access.

register.description: The configuration 1 register sets signal control parameters per chip select.

bitfield.description: Enables the wrapping burst capability. Must be set if the attached device is configured in wrapping burst
Selects the read single or multiple access
Selects the read mode operation
Selects the write single or multiple access
Selects the write mode operation
Output GPMC.CLK activation time
Specifies the attached device page (burst) length (1 Word = Interface size)
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Read accesses.
Selects the Wait monitoring configuration for Write accesses
Selects input pin Wait monitoring time
Selects the input WAIT pin for this chip select.
Selects the device size attached (Reset value is SYSBOOT[8] input pin sampled at IC reset for CS[0] (active low) and 01 for CS[1] to CS[6] (active low)).
Selects the attached device type
Enables the Address and data multiplexed protocol (Reset value is SYSBOOT[11] and SYSBOOT[10] input pin sampled at IC reset for CS[0] (active low) and 0 for CS[1] to CS[6] (active low)).

Signals timing latencies scalar factor (Rd/WRCycleTime, AccessTime, PageBurstAccessTime, CSOnTime, CSRd/WrOffTime, ADVOnTime, ADVRd/WrOffTime, OEOnTime, OEOffTime, WEOnTime, WEOffTime, Cycle2CycleDelay, BusTurnAround, TimeOutStartValue).
Divides the GPMC.FCLK clock.

register.description: Chip-select signal timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
CS# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
CS# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
CS# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: ADV# signal timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: ADV# de-assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Mux protocol
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for write accesses
ADV# de-assertion time from start cycle time for read accesses
ADV# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
ADV# assertion for first address phase when using the AAD-Multiplexed protocol
ADV# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: WE# and OE# signals timing parameter configuration.

bitfield.description: WE# de-assertion time from start cycle time
WE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
WE# assertion time from start cycle time
OE# de-assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Multiplexed access
OE# de-assertion time from start cycle time
OE# Add Extra Half GPMC.FCLK cycle
OE# assertion time for the first address phase in an AAD-Multiplexed access
OE# assertion time from start cycle time

register.description: RdAccessTime and CycleTime timing parameters configuration.

bitfield.description: Delay between successive words in a multiple access
Delay between start cycle time and first data valid
Total write cycle time
Total read cycle time

register.description: WrAccessTime, WrDataOnADmuxBus, Cycle2Cycle, and BusTurnAround parameters configuration

bitfield.description: Delay from StartAccessTime to the GPMC.FCLK rising edge corresponding the the GPMC.CLK rising edge used by the attached memory for the first data capture
Specifies on which GPMC.FCLK rising edge the first data of the synchronous burst write is driven in the add/data multiplexed bus
Chip select high pulse delay between two successive accesses
Add Cycle2CycleDelay between two successive accesses to the same chip-select (any access type)
Add Cycle2CycleDelay between two successive accesses to a different chip-select (any access type)
Bus turn around latency between two successive accesses to the same chip-select (read to write) or to a different chip-select (read to read and read to write)

register.description: Chip-select address mapping configuration.

bitfield.description: Chip-select mask address. Values not listed must be avoided as they create holes in the chip-select address space.
Chip-select enable (reset value is 1 for CS[0] (active low) and 0 for CS[1] to CS[5] (active low)).
Chip-select base address. CSi base address where i = 0 to 3 (16 Mbytes minimum granularity). Bits 5 to 0 correspond to A29, A28, A27, A26, A25, and A24.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_COMMAND_6 location places the data as the NAND command value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Writing data at the GPMC_NAND_ADDRESS_6 location places the data as the NAND partial address value on the bus, using a regular asynchronous write access.

register.description: This register is not a true register, just an address location.

bitfield.description: Reading data from the GPMC_NAND_DATA_6 location or from any location in the associated chip-select memory region activates an asynchronous read access.
Define the number of GPMC.FCLK cycles to be substracted from RdCycleTime, WrCycleTime, AccessTime, CSRdOffTime, CSWrOffTime, ADVRdOffTime, ADVWrOffTime, OEOffTime, WEOffTime
Enables access cycle optimization
Selects the CS (active low) where Prefetch Postwrite engine is active
Selects the number of bytes to be read or written by the engine to the selected CS (active low)
Resets the FIFO pointer and starts the engine
Set when FIFOPointer exceeds FIFOThreshold value.
Number of remaining bytes to be read or to be written by the engine according to the TransferCount value.
ECC algorithm used
Error correction capability used for BCH
Spare area organization definition for the BCH algorithm. See the BCH syndrome/parity calculator module functional specification for more details
Selects an ECC calculated on 16 columns
Number of sectors to process with the BCH algorithm
Selects the Chip-select where ECC is computed
Enables the ECC feature
Clear all ECC result registers

Selects ECC result register (Reads to this field give the dynamic position of the ECC pointer - Writes to this field select the ECC result register where the first ECC computation will be stored). Writing values not listed disables the ECC engine (ECCEnable bit of GPMC_ECC_CONFIG cleared to 0).
Defines ECC size 1
Defines ECC size 0
Selects ECC size for ECC 9 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 8 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 7 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 6 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 5 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 4 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 3 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 2 result register
Selects ECC size for ECC 1 result register

register.description: This register is used to directly pass data to the BCH ECC calculator without accessing the actual NAND flash interface.

bitfield.description: Data to be included in the BCH calculation. Only bits 0 to 7 are taken into account, if the calculator is configured to use 8 bits data (GPMC_ECC_CONFIG[7] ECC16B = 0).
